required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Immunogenicity & Safety of Hepatitis A Vaccine Co-admin With a Measles/Mumps/Rubella & a Varicella Vaccine in Children
clinical_study.official_title: Immunogenicity & Safety of GSK Biologicals' Inactivated Hepatitis A Vaccine (Havrix™) Co-administered With Merck & Company, Inc. Measles-Mumps-Rubella Vaccine (M-M-RII) & Merck & Co Varicella Vaccine (VARIVAX™) to Children 15 Months of Age

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a study to evaluate the immune response and safety of GSK Biologicals 2-dose inactivated hepatitis A vaccine when administered with a measles/mumps/rubella vaccine and a varicella (chickenpox) vaccine in children as young as 15 months of age.
The Protocol Posting has been updated in order to comply with the FDA Amendment Act, Sep 2007.

detailed_description.textblock: An open, controlled comparison of Havrix™ administered alone or with MMR II and Varivax™. The three groups evaluated are: 1) Havrix™ alone, 2) Havrix™ + MMR II and Varivax™ and 3) MMR II and Varivax™ followed by Havrix™ one month later.

primary_outcome.measure: Anti-hepatitis A Virus (HAV) Antibody Concentrations in HAV and HAV+MMR+V Groups.
primary_outcome.time_frame: 31 days following the second dose of Havrix®
primary_outcome.description: Concentrations are given as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs) expressed as milli-international units per milliliter (mIU/mL).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-hepatitis A Virus (HAV) Antibody Concentration Equal or Above the Cut-off Value in HAV and HAV+MMR+V Groups
primary_outcome.time_frame: 31 days following the second dose of Havrix®
primary_outcome.description: Anti-HAV antibody cut-off value assessed include 15 milli-international units per milliliter (mIU/mL).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Seroconverted for Anti-measle, Anti-mumps and Anti-varicella Antibodies in HAV+MMR+V and MMR+V→HAV Groups
primary_outcome.time_frame: 42 days following the administration of M-M-R®II and VARIVAX®
primary_outcome.description: Seroconversion is defined as the appearance of antibodies with titers greater than or equal to the predefined cut-off value in the serum of subject seronegative before vaccination. Cut-off values assessed include 150 milli-international units per milliliter (mIU/mL) for anti-measles antibodies, 28 Effective Dose 50 (ED50) for anti-mumps antibodies and 1:5 for anti-varicella antibodies.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Vaccine Response for Anti-rubella Antibodies in HAV+MMR+V and MMR+V→HAV Groups
primary_outcome.time_frame: 42 days following administration of M-M-R®II and VARIVAX®
primary_outcome.description: Vaccine response is defined as the appearance of antibodies with titers greater than or equal to the predefined cut-off value in the serum of subject seronegative before vaccination. Cut-off value assessed include 10 milli-international units per milliliter (mIU/mL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Anti-measles, Anti-mumps, Anti-rubella and Anti-varicella Antibody Titers in HAV+MMR+V and MMR+V→HAV Groups
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 42 days following the administration of M-M-R®II and VARIVAX®
secondary_outcome.description: Titers are given as geometric mean titers (GMTs).

secondary_outcome.measure: Anti-hepatitis A Virus (HAV) Antibody Concentrations in HAV and HAV+MMR+V Groups
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 42 days following the first dose of Havrix®
secondary_outcome.description: Concentrations are given as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-hepatitis A Virus (HAV) Antibody Concentration Equal or Above the Cut-off Value in HAV and HAV+MMR+V Groups
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 42 days following the first dose of Havrix®
secondary_outcome.description: Anti-HAV antibody cut-off value assessed include 15 milli-international units per millilitre (mIU/mL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Anti-hepatitis A Virus (HAV) Antibody Concentrations in MMR+V→HAV Group
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 31 days following the second dose of Havrix®
secondary_outcome.description: Concentrations are given as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-hepatitis A Virus (HAV) Antibody Concentrations Above the Cut-off Value in MMR+V→HAV Group
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 31 days following the second dose of Havrix®
secondary_outcome.description: Anti-HAV antibody cut-off value assessed include 15 milli-international units per millilitre (mIU/mL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Vaccine Response to Havrix®
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 31 days following the second dose of Havrix®
secondary_outcome.description: Vaccine response was defined as: 1) a detectable anti-hepatitis A virus (HAV) antibody concentration 31 days following the second dose in subjects who were initially seronegative; and 2) a 2-fold increase in anti-HAV antibody concentrations above the pre-study concentration 31 days following the second dose in subjects who were initially seropositive.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Solicited Local Symptoms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day period following each dose of vaccine
secondary_outcome.description: Solicited local symptoms assessed include pain, rash (local), redness and swelling.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Solicited General Symptoms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day period following each dose of vaccine
secondary_outcome.description: Solicited general symptoms assessed include drowsiness, fever, irritability, loss of appetite and rash (general).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Measles, Mumps, Rubella and Varicella Specific Solicited General Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 43-day period following each dose of vaccine
secondary_outcome.description: Specific adverse events assessed include papules, vesicles, crusts, parotid/salivary gland swelling and suspected signs of meningitis/febrile seizures.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 31-day period following each dose of vaccine
secondary_outcome.description: Unsolicited AE covers any AE reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the Active Phase (from Day 0 up to Day 31 after the second dose) and the Extended Safety Follow-up Phase of the study (from Day 31 after the second dose up to study end)
secondary_outcome.description: SAEs assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization, result in disability/incapacity or are a congenital anomaly/birth defect in the offspring of a study subject.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting New Chronic Illnesses
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the Active Phase (from Day 0 up to Day 31 after the second dose) and the Extended Safety Follow-up Phase of the study (from Day 31 after the second dose up to study end)
secondary_outcome.description: New Chronic illnesses include autoimmune disorders, asthma, type I diabetes, allergies.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Medically Significant Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the Active Phase (from Day 0 up to Day 31 after the second dose) and the Extended Safety Follow-up Phase of the study (from Day 31 after the second dose up to study end)
secondary_outcome.description: Medically significant events include, but are not limited to, diabetes, autoimmune disease, asthma, allergies and/or conditions prompting emergency room or physician office visits that are not related to well-child care, vaccination or common acute illnesses (e.g., upper respiratory infection, otitis media, pharyngitis, gastroenteritis, injury and visits for routine physical examination).

arm_group.description: Subjects received 2 doses of Havrix® (1 dose at Day 0 and 1 dose between Month 6 and Month 9)
Subjects received 1 dose of Havrix®, coadministered with M-M-R®II and VARIVAX®, at Day 0 and 1 dose of Havrix® between Month 6 and Month 9
Subjects received 1 dose of M-M-R®II and VARIVAX® at Day 0 and then 2 doses of Havrix® (1 dose at Day 42 and 1 dose between Month 7.5 and Month 10.5)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects whose parents/guardians are believed by the investigator to be willing to comply with the requirements of the protocol
- A male or female child 12 and 13 months of age at the time of entry into the Enrollment Phase
- Written informed consent obtained from the parents or guardian of the subject,
- Free of obvious health problems as established by medical history and history-directed physical examination before entering into the study, and
- Parents/guardian of the subject must have a telephone or be able to be contacted by telephone
Exclusion Criteria:
- Use of any investigational or non-registered drug or vaccine other than the study vaccine(s) within 42 days preceding the first dose of study vaccine, or planned use during the study period, Chronic administration (defined as more than 14 days) of immuno-suppressant or other immune-modifying drugs within six months prior to vaccination or planned administration at any time during the study period. (For corticosteroids, this will mean prednisone, or equivalent, ≥0.5 mg/kg/day. Inhaled, nasal and topical steroids are allowed.) Planned administration or administration of any vaccine not foreseen by the study protocol during the period 31 days before and 31 days after each dose of study vaccine(s).
- Previous vaccination against hepatitis A,
- History of hepatitis A,
- Known exposure to hepatitis A,
- Previous vaccination against measles, mumps, rubella and/or varicella,
- History of measles, mumps, rubella and/or varicella,
- Known exposure to measles, mumps, rubella and/or varicella within 30 days prior to the start of the study,
- Planned chronic use of salicylates during the 6-week period following administration of the doses of study vaccine(s),
- Any confirmed or suspected immunosuppressive or immunodeficient condition, including human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection,
- A family history of congenital, hereditary or infectious immunodeficiency or parental risk factors for HIV infection,
- History of allergic disease/reactions or hypersensitivity likely to be exacerbated by any component of HavrixTM, M-M-RII or VARIVAXTM, including 2-phenoxyethanol, neomycin and gelatin,
- History of anaphylactic or anaphylactoid reactions to egg proteins,
- History of hypersensitivity/allergic reaction to latex. Note: The tip cap and the rubber plunger of the HavrixTM needleless pre-filled syringes contain dry natural latex rubber.
- Major congenital defects or serious chronic illness,
- Active untreated tuberculosis,
- History of significant blood dyscrasias
- History of any neurologic disorder (a history of febrile seizures not associated with an underlying neurological disorder does not exclude the subject)
- Acute disease at the time of vaccination
- Administration of immunoglobulins and/or any blood products within three months prior to the first dose of study vaccine or planned administration at any time during the entire study period

link.description: Researchers can use this site to request access to anonymised patient level data and/or supporting documents from clinical studies to conduct further research.

reference.citation: Rinderknecht S, Michaels MG, Blatter M, Gaglani M, Andrews W, Abughali N, Chandreshekaran V, Trofa AF. Immunogenicity and safety of an inactivated hepatitis A vaccine when coadministered with measles-mumps-rubella and varicella vaccines in children less than 2 years of age. Pediatr Infect Dis J. 2011 Oct;30(10):e179-85. doi: 10.1097/INF.0b013e31822256a5.

patient_data.ipd_description: Patient-level data for this study will be made available through www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com following the timelines and process described on this site.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: While the total numbers of subjects enrolled in the study was 1474, the total number of subjects that entered the study was 1241. The remaining subjects received a subject number but no vaccine dose and were therefore excluded from the analysis and group assignment.

group.title: HAV Group
group.description: Subjects received 2 doses of Havrix® (1 dose at Day 0 and 1 dose between Month 6 and Month 9)

group.title: MMR+V→HAV Group
group.description: Subjects received 1 dose of M-M-R®II and VARIVAX® at Day 0 and then 2 doses of Havrix® (1 dose at Day 42 and 1 dose between Month 7.5 and Month 10.5)

group.title: HAV+MMR+V Group
group.description: Subjects received 1 dose of Havrix®, coadministered with M-M-R®II and VARIVAX®, at Day 0 and 1 dose of Havrix® between Month 6 and Month 9

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Anti-hepatitis A Virus (HAV) Antibody Concentrations in HAV and HAV+MMR+V Groups.
outcome.description: Concentrations are given as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs) expressed as milli-international units per milliliter (mIU/mL).
outcome.time_frame: 31 days following the second dose of Havrix®
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on the According-To-Protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity, on subjects with available results from HAV and HAV+MMR+V Groups.

outcome.time_frame: During the 43-day period following each dose of vaccine
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, on subjects from MMR+V→HAV and HAV+MMR+V groups.

group.title: HAV Group
group.description: Subjects received 2 doses of Havrix® (1 dose at Day 0 and 1 dose between Month 6 and Month 9)

group.title: MMR+V→HAV Group
group.description: Subjects received 1 dose of M-M-R®II and VARIVAX® at Day 0 and then 2 doses of Havrix® (1 dose at Day 42 and 1 dose between Month 7.5 and Month 10.5)

measure.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Measles, Mumps, Rubella and Varicella Specific Solicited General Adverse Events
measure.description: Specific adverse events assessed include papules, vesicles, crusts, parotid/salivary gland swelling and suspected signs of meningitis/febrile seizures.
measure.population: Analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, on subjects from MMR+V→HAV and HAV+MMR+V groups.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Seroconverted for Anti-measle, Anti-mumps and Anti-varicella Antibodies in HAV+MMR+V and MMR+V→HAV Groups
outcome.description: Seroconversion is defined as the appearance of antibodies with titers greater than or equal to the predefined cut-off value in the serum of subject seronegative before vaccination. Cut-off values assessed include 150 milli-international units per milliliter (mIU/mL) for anti-measles antibodies, 28 Effective Dose 50 (ED50) for anti-mumps antibodies and 1:5 for anti-varicella antibodies.
outcome.time_frame: 42 days following the administration of M-M-R®II and VARIVAX®
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on the According-To-Protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity, on subjects with available results from HAV+MMR+V and MMR+V→HAV groups.

group.title: HAV Group
group.description: Subjects received 2 doses of Havrix® (1 dose at Day 0 and 1 dose between Month 6 and Month 9)

group.title: MMR+V→HAV Group
group.description: Subjects received 1 dose of M-M-R®II and VARIVAX® at Day 0 and then 2 doses of Havrix® (1 dose at Day 42 and 1 dose between Month 7.5 and Month 10.5)

group.title: HAV+MMR+V Group
group.description: Subjects received 1 dose of Havrix®, coadministered with M-M-R®II and VARIVAX®, at Day 0 and 1 dose of Havrix® between Month 6 and Month 9

measure.title: Number of Subjects Seroconverted for Anti-measle, Anti-mumps and Anti-varicella Antibodies in HAV+MMR+V and MMR+V→HAV Groups
measure.description: Seroconversion is defined as the appearance of antibodies with titers greater than or equal to the predefined cut-off value in the serum of subject seronegative before vaccination. Cut-off values assessed include 150 milli-international units per milliliter (mIU/mL) for anti-measles antibodies, 28 Effective Dose 50 (ED50) for anti-mumps antibodies and 1:5 for anti-varicella antibodies.
measure.population: Analysis was performed on the According-To-Protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity, on subjects with available results from HAV+MMR+V and MMR+V→HAV groups.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Vaccine Response for Anti-rubella Antibodies in HAV+MMR+V and MMR+V→HAV Groups
outcome.description: Vaccine response is defined as the appearance of antibodies with titers greater than or equal to the predefined cut-off value in the serum of subject seronegative before vaccination. Cut-off value assessed include 10 milli-international units per milliliter (mIU/mL).
outcome.time_frame: 42 days following administration of M-M-R®II and VARIVAX®
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on the According-To-Protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity, on subjects with available results from HAV+MMR+V and MMR+V→HAV groups.

group.title: HAV Group
group.description: Subjects received 2 doses of Havrix® (1 dose at Day 0 and 1 dose between Month 6 and Month 9)

group.title: MMR+V→HAV Group
group.description: Subjects received 1 dose of M-M-R®II and VARIVAX® at Day 0 and then 2 doses of Havrix® (1 dose at Day 42 and 1 dose between Month 7.5 and Month 10.5)

group.title: HAV+MMR+V Group
group.description: Subjects received 1 dose of Havrix®, coadministered with M-M-R®II and VARIVAX®, at Day 0 and 1 dose of Havrix® between Month 6 and Month 9

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Vaccine Response for Anti-rubella Antibodies in HAV+MMR+V and MMR+V→HAV Groups
measure.description: Vaccine response is defined as the appearance of antibodies with titers greater than or equal to the predefined cut-off value in the serum of subject seronegative before vaccination. Cut-off value assessed include 10 milli-international units per milliliter (mIU/mL).
measure.population: Analysis was performed on the According-To-Protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity, on subjects with available results from HAV+MMR+V and MMR+V→HAV groups.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs)
outcome.description: Unsolicited AE covers any AE reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms
outcome.time_frame: During the 31-day period following each dose of vaccine
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort.

group.title: HAV Group
group.description: Subjects received 2 doses of Havrix® (1 dose at Day 0 and 1 dose between Month 6 and Month 9)

group.title: MMR+V→HAV Group
group.description: Subjects received 1 dose of M-M-R®II and VARIVAX® at Day 0 and then 2 doses of Havrix® (1 dose at Day 42 and 1 dose between Month 7.5 and Month 10.5)

group.title: HAV+MMR+V Group
group.description: Subjects received 1 dose of Havrix®, coadministered with M-M-R®II and VARIVAX®, at Day 0 and 1 dose of Havrix® between Month 6 and Month 9

measure.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs)
measure.description: Unsolicited AE covers any AE reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms
measure.population: Analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
outcome.description: SAEs assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization, result in disability/incapacity or are a congenital anomaly/birth defect in the offspring of a study subject.
outcome.time_frame: During the Active Phase (from Day 0 up to Day 31 after the second dose) and the Extended Safety Follow-up Phase of the study (from Day 31 after the second dose up to study end)
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort.

group.title: HAV Group
group.description: Subjects received 2 doses of Havrix® (1 dose at Day 0 and 1 dose between Month 6 and Month 9)

group.title: MMR+V→HAV Group
group.description: Subjects received 1 dose of M-M-R®II and VARIVAX® at Day 0 and then 2 doses of Havrix® (1 dose at Day 42 and 1 dose between Month 7.5 and Month 10.5)

group.title: HAV+MMR+V Group
group.description: Subjects received 1 dose of Havrix®, coadministered with M-M-R®II and VARIVAX®, at Day 0 and 1 dose of Havrix® between Month 6 and Month 9

measure.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
measure.description: SAEs assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization, result in disability/incapacity or are a congenital anomaly/birth defect in the offspring of a study subject.
measure.population: Analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting New Chronic Illnesses
outcome.description: New Chronic illnesses include autoimmune disorders, asthma, type I diabetes, allergies.
outcome.time_frame: During the Active Phase (from Day 0 up to Day 31 after the second dose) and the Extended Safety Follow-up Phase of the study (from Day 31 after the second dose up to study end)
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort (for the Active Phase) and the Extended Safety Follow-up cohort (for the Extended Safety Follow-up Phase).

group.title: HAV Group
group.description: Subjects received 2 doses of Havrix® (1 dose at Day 0 and 1 dose between Month 6 and Month 9)

group.title: MMR+V→HAV Group
group.description: Subjects received 1 dose of M-M-R®II and VARIVAX® at Day 0 and then 2 doses of Havrix® (1 dose at Day 42 and 1 dose between Month 7.5 and Month 10.5)

group.title: HAV+MMR+V Group
group.description: Subjects received 1 dose of Havrix®, coadministered with M-M-R®II and VARIVAX®, at Day 0 and 1 dose of Havrix® between Month 6 and Month 9

measure.title: Number of Subjects Reporting New Chronic Illnesses
measure.description: New Chronic illnesses include autoimmune disorders, asthma, type I diabetes, allergies.
measure.population: Analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort (for the Active Phase) and the Extended Safety Follow-up cohort (for the Extended Safety Follow-up Phase).

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Medically Significant Events
outcome.description: Medically significant events include, but are not limited to, diabetes, autoimmune disease, asthma, allergies and/or conditions prompting emergency room or physician office visits that are not related to well-child care, vaccination or common acute illnesses (e.g., upper respiratory infection, otitis media, pharyngitis, gastroenteritis, injury and visits for routine physical examination).
outcome.time_frame: During the Active Phase (from Day 0 up to Day 31 after the second dose) and the Extended Safety Follow-up Phase of the study (from Day 31 after the second dose up to study end)
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort (for the Active Phase) and the Extended Safety Follow-up cohort (for the Extended Safety Follow-up Phase).

group.description: Subjects received 1 dose of Havrix®, coadministered with M-M-R®II and VARIVAX®, at Day 0 and 1 dose of Havrix® between Month 6 and Month 9

measure.population: Analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort (for the Active Phase) and the Extended Safety Follow-up cohort (for the Extended Safety Follow-up Phase).

reported_events.desc: Events collected by systematic assessment are reported for subjects with a symptom diary card available. Events collected by non-systematic method are reported for the Total Vaccinated Cohort

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
